schema.name: moe_stans.resourcerecord
schema.comment: This schema defines the tables needed to store resources and their recommendations, as well as tags, and tag types.
Version 2016/01/04: clobs changed to varchar(max) in order to migrate from oracle to SQLServer - Chamath
Update: changed timestamp variable to datetime2(7) - Chamath

column.name: pk1
column.comment: This is the primary key for the table

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who created the resource

column.name: go_live_date
column.comment: When this resource was made live

column.name: parent_id
column.comment: Recursive relation

column.name: recommendation
column.comment: The final recommendation status (0 or null for not live, 1 for live, 2 for approved but not yet live)

column.name: out_of_print
column.comment: Whether or not it's out of print (0 or null for no, 1 for yes)

column.name: dont_show_if_child
column.comment: Whether or not to list this resource on its own if it has a parent record (since it will also be listed under the parent). Made it dont_show since it was added later on, and most records will have null value.

column.name: is_core
column.comment: 0/null = additional, 1 = core, 2 = support

column.name: is_rover
column.comment: Whether or not this resource is a ROVER video.

column.name: quick_title
column.comment: NOTE: OBSOLETE - USE title INSTEAD. All of the quick_* columns are used for faster queries and display of previews/summaries. When a DB-wide search is performed, we can just query these columns and not have to do intensive joins and multiple queries over other tables.

column.name: quick_description
column.comment: See the comments for quick_title.

column.name: quick_info
column.comment: See the comments for quick_title. Not exactly sure what the format of this column will be yet, but we can use it for other pertinent info about the resource.

column.name: quick_pic
column.comment: See the comments for quick_title. Can be used to hold the image path.

column.name: pk1
column.comment: This is the primary key for the table

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who created the recommendation

column.name: resource_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the resource

column.name: recommended
column.comment: Whether or not it was recommended (used int in case other possible values/situations arise)

column.name: comments
column.comment: Comments about the users decision

column.name: pk1
column.comment: This is the primary key for the table

column.name: tagtype_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the associated tagtype

column.name: parent_id
column.comment: Not currently used. Note that this is a different parent than the one referenced by the parent_id column in the moe_resource_tag table.

column.name: information_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the associated tag_information row

column.name: pk1
column.comment: This is the primary key for the table

table.name: moe_resource_tag
table.comment: Join table for resources and tags

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who associated the resource and the tag

column.name: resource_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the resource

column.name: tag_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the tag

column.name: parent_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the parent tag, if there is one (can be null). Note that the parent will also have its own moe_resource_tag row to link it directly to the resource

table.name: moe_recommendation_tag
table.comment: Join table for tags and recommendations. Not currently used

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who associated the tag and the recommendation

column.name: recommendation_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the recommendation

column.name: tag_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the tag

table.name: moe_tag_information
table.comment: Info for tags such as publisher addresses, etc.

column.name: information
column.comment: The info

table.name: moe_resource_text
table.comment: Table for annotations, notes, comments, etc. Anything that would require a CLOB column, basically.

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who wrote it

column.name: resource_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the resource

column.name: type
column.comment: Type of info (annotation, note, comments, etc.)

column.name: text
column.comment: The info

table.name: moe_rnumber_incrementer
table.comment: Keeps track of the R Numbers

table.name: moe_resource_flag
table.comment: Allows users to flag a resource for follow-up. Not part of the permanent resource record; just for taggers to stay organized.

column.name: resource_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the resource

column.name: user_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who flagged it

column.name: reason_code
column.comment: Integer representing the reason for flagging. Not sure yet if this will be used or what the reason codes will be, but best to add it now anyway.

column.name: comments
column.comment: Optional comments field

table.name: moe_cached_list
table.comment: For faster loading times, pk1s returned by common queries will be cached.

column.name: pk1_list
column.comment: Comma-separated list of pk1s

column.name: query_name
column.comment: An identifier for the query

table.name: moe_resource_resource
table.comment: Table for resource self-joins. Implemented for the Selection-Source type specifically, but could have a more general use.

column.name: created_by
column.comment: The pk1 of the BB user who associated the resources

column.name: resource_1_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the first resource

column.name: resource_2_id
column.comment: The pk1 of the second resource

column.name: resource_1_type
column.comment: The type of the first resource

column.name: resource_2_type
column.comment: The type of the second resource
